stk.ga.ga_population module¶

Defines GAPopulation.

GAPopulation extends Population by addings tools for carrying out GA operations.

class stk.ga.ga_population.GAPopulation(*args, ga_tools=<stk.ga.ga_tools.GATools object>)¶

Bases: stk.population.Population

Used for applying GA operations to molecules.

The GA is invoked by calling a number of methods of this class, such as gen_offspring(), gen_mutants() and select(). However, this class only implements container related functionality. It delegates GA operations to the Crossover, Mutation and Selection classes.

These classes are organised as follows. Each GAPopulation instance has a ga_tools attribute. This holds a GATools instance. The GATools instance is just a container. It holds a Crossover, Mutation and Selection instance. These instances deal with the GAPopulation instance they are held by and perform the various crossover, mutation and selection operations on it. Any functionality related to the GA should be delegated to these instances. The gen_offspring() and gen_mutants() methods can serve as a guide to how this should be done.

ga_tools¶

An instance of the GATools class. It stores instances of classes such as Selection, Mutation and Crossover, which carry out GA operations on the population.

Type

GATools

calculate_member_fitness(processes=8)¶

Applies the fitness function to all members.

The fitness function is defined in the attribute GATools.fitness of the GATools instance held in the ga_tools attribute of the population.

The calculation will be performed serially or in parallel depending on the flag GATools.parallel. The serial version may be faster in cases where all molecules have already had their fitness values calcluated. This is because all calculations will be skipped. In this case creating a parallel process pool creates unncessary overhead.

Notes

This method will result in the modification of the MacroMolecule.unscaled_fitness attribute of molecules held by the population.

Parameters

processes (int) – The number of parallel processes to create.

Returns

None

Return type

NoneType

exit(progress)¶

Checks the if the EA exit criterion has been satisfied.

Parameters

progress (GAPopulation) – population where each subpopulation is a previous generation.

Returns

True if the exit criterion is satisfied, else False.

Return type

bool

gen_mutants(counter_name='mutation_counter.png')¶

Returns a GAPopulation of mutants.

The selection function which decides which molecules are selected for mutation is defined in the Selection.mutation attribute of the Selection instance held by the population via its ga_tools attribute.

The mutation function(s) to be used are defined in the Mutation instance held by the population via its ga_tools attribute.

Parameters

counter_name (str, optional) – The name of the .png file which holds a graph showing which members were selected for mutation.

Returns

A population holding mutants created by mutating the MacroMolecule instances held by the population.

Return type

GAPopulation

gen_next_gen(pop_size, counter_path='')¶

Returns a population holding the next generation of structures.

The selection function to be used for selecting the next generation of molecules is defined in the Selection instance held by the population via its ga_tools attribute.

Parameters

  • pop_size (int) – The size of the next generation.

  • counter_path (str, optional) – The name of the .png file holding a graph showing which members were selected for the next generation. If '' then no file is made.

Returns

A population holding the next generation of molecules.

Return type

GAPopulation

gen_offspring(counter_name='crossover_counter.png')¶

Returns a GAPopulation of offspring molecules.

The selection function which decides which molecules are selected for crossover is defined in the Selection.crossover attribute of the Selection instance held by the population via its ga_tools attribute.

The crossover function(s) to be used are defined in the Crossover instance held by the population via its ga_tools attribute.

Parameters

counter_name (str, optional) – The name of the .png file showing which members were selected for crossover.

Returns

A population of offspring, created by crossing MacroMolecule instances contained in the population.

Return type

GAPopulation

ga_tools (GATools, optional) – The GATools instance to use.

normalize_fitness_values()¶

Applies the normalization functions on the population.

Normalization functions scale or modify the fitness values of molecules in the population.

The normalization functions which are applied on the population, along with their order, are defined in the Normalization instance held by the population via the ga_tools attribute.

Notes

This method modifies the MacroMolecule.fitness attribute of molecules held by the population.

Returns

None

Return type

NoneType

select(type='generational')¶

Returns a generator for yielding members of the population.

Members are yielded based on the selection function defined in the Selection instance held by the population via the ga_tools attribute. The instance defines 3 selection functions, 1 for each type.

Parameters

type (str, optional) –

A string specifying the type of selection to be performed. Valid values will correspond to names of attributes of the Selection class.

Valid values are:

  • 'generational' - selects the next generation

  • 'crossover' - selects molecules for crossover

  • 'mutation' - selects molecules for mutation

Returns

A generator which yields molecules or tuples of them.

Return type

generator
